content: 1 THE elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
content_old: 1 THE elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

content: 2 Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
content_old: 2 Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

content: 3 For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
content_old: 3 For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

content: 4 I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.
content_old: 4 I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

content: 5 Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;
content_old: 5 Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

content: 6 which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:
content_old: 6 which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

content: 7 because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
content_old: 7 because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

content: 8 We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.
content_old: 8 We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

content: 9 I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
content_old: 9 I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

content: 10 Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.
content_old: 10 Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.

content: 11 Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
content_old: 11 Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

content: 12 Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.
content_old: 12 Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

content: 13 I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:
content_old: 13 I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:
